docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands of unionized telephone workers shut down directory assistance in New York yesterday as they staged a two-and-a-half-hour wildcat walkout aimed at pressuring Bell Atlantic to help avoid a strike at 12:01 A.M. Sunday, when their contract expires. Walking off the job yesterday afternoon, the workers gave millions of consumers a taste of the inconveniences that would be suffered in a full-fledged strike. The workers held raucous demonstrations at phone company buildings in Manhattan, the Bronx and upstate New York.

headline.main: Phone Workers Stage a Walkout as Strike Deadline Nears

docs.abstract: Thousands of unionized telephone workers shut down directory assistance in New York as they stage wildcat walkout and raucous demonstrations in Manhattan, the Bronx and upstate aimed at pressuring Bell Atlantic to help avoid strike on Aug 9, when their contract expires; photo (M)
